Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, but a little bit far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Bobi86
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay there, the hotel is clean and modern, the staff was very helpful and they had a great breakfast there! Rooms were very nice with great bathroom. Great price/value hotel, but it is far from city centre. The underground station is about minutes from hotel by shuttle service. But be careful, that it can be full and you have to wait for another shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for First Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: brendanandangela
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the city of Rome, we had looked at hotels nearer the centre but the prices were obviously more expensive and when we looked at the cheaper hotels the reviews by some of the Trip Advisor reviewers were enough to make us look further. We chose the Idea Hotel Roma Z3 based on other reviews especially the free shuttle link to the Metro. We arrived at the Hotel after a torturous journey from the Airport (we were the last drop off) the Rome baggage handlers took an hour to off load our baggage so it was 3 hours before we arrived at the Hotel. First impressions were very good, the reception staff were very helpful although they pointed out that the free shuttle to the metro had been withdrawn which was one of the main reasons we had booked in the first place. The gentleman on reception was very helpful though, providing us with maps of the bus & metro links. To get into the city: walk through the Auchan supermarket car park in front of the hotel, opposite the bus shelter is a road leading to the right, walk 30m and there is another bus stop on the right hand side. Wait for a number 450 bus (we had purchased a Roma Pass at the airport) when you board scan the bar code on the reader to validate your ticket, after a couple of stops leave the bus at the Metro Line B station S. M. Soccorso, again scan the Roma Pass into the scanner to enter the platform and your on your way, you can choose to leave at Termini (Lots of "Lowlife" hustlers) change lines (B to A) or carry on to the Colosseum for example, the Rome transport system worked very well. Back to the hotel, our room was quite small but well furnished,the small bathroom was very clean, the breakfast was a bit hit & miss depending on the time you arrived, when it was busy the bacon & egg trays were left empty for long periods but overall our stay was very pleasant. The position of the Hotel on the east side of Rome meant that the above guide for travelling into the city was a necessity, the downside was that we never stayed in the city late at night so next time we will look to stay in the centre but would recommend this hotel f your on a budget and don't mind the travel. The 7 euro charge for Internet connection was a bit steep, indeed the city of Rome seemed bare of "Free Wi-Fi" zones compared to other cities. We only dined one night at the hotel, we took advantage of the 19 Euro set menu which was very nice & good value compared to some of our dining experiences in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: BrooksJapan
Reviews.Content: Well it is near a hypermarket which is good for shopping. A train station and a tram stop are nearby. Maybe it is better to walk to the tram station. Go by Auchan, then walk by a park, and it takes 15 minutes. The tram goes to Termini, but if you get off one station before, you can take the subway from there. I tried to avoid Termini if I could, since it is so big and crowded. There is a bus to the train station. It would have been nicer to stay closer to the center of the city, but it costs less. The shower wasn`t so good, since the glass was only for half the shower. I got a little bit of water on the floor. There is a minibar where I put the alcohol and cheese I bought at Auchan. It is a modern hotel. The elevators are new and work well. I stayed up on the 7th floor. Free breakfast, but get there are early. Lots of people ate there. I guess the thing I missed is that they didn`t have any computer I could use to check my e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: BedaBest
Reviews.Content: Had a problem with the reception as they are unable to speak fluent English. WiFi is chargeable at 7 Euros for a 24 Hour Period. Hotel rooms and corridor are pretty al-right for a 4 star hotel. There's a Auchan supermarket about a minute's walk away from the hotel and a Carrefour Express supermarket further down.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel,but you pay for internet...”
Reviews.Author: Mihaela M
Reviews.Content: Very elegant, clean, rich breakfast, transportation to the subway is very helpful, courtesy of the staff served us.Everything was of grade 10, less kindly of staff at reception.Maybe my English is not very good,but''complimentary''means ''gratuito'' or ''in omaggio'',in italian.So then you have to pay ,if the room facilities that the Internet is ''complimentary''?In my opinion four star hotel should offer internet included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly central, but what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: murf-707
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place isn't exactly in the centre of rome but I was aware of that when booking, so knew what to expect. What I had hoped for, but didn't expect was fabulous rooms, extremely polite, friendly and helpful staff and great food. I had read a few reviews that said how far out it is and how long it took to get to the attractions, but in reality it's not that bad. The hotels minibus has you at the the Rebibbia metro station in a matter of minutes and then it only takes about 15 minutes to get to Termini. The trains do get very packed but, as Rebibbia is the starting point for the line, we always got a seat. On the way back, it wasn't always the case but, there was normally seats by the time we reached Turbitina and it's not that long anyway. As a side note, I observed that Romans are very good at giving up their seats for the elderly, women and anyone else that looks as if they may be struggling. The hotels restaurant was staffed by great staff that served fantastic food. Apart from breakfast we only ate there once for an evening meal (only because we was out all day and ate wherever we was), but it was great. We took advantage of the set meal, which was 3 courses, bread, wine and water for only €19 each. The hotel itself, was always spotelss throughout and all staff very welcoming and friendly. Our room was absolutely spotless and kept that way everyway by the very friendly housekeeping staff. Although there is nothing much in the immediate area it didn't affect us at all, and to be honest a lot of the rest of Rome is a bit dingy looking - apart from the sights of course. If I have any critism, it's that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms (as I like to have a cup of tea before going down to breakfast and in the evening), but I brought a travel kettle and got supplies from the supermarket across the road. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.....Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Do not need worry about distance but stung in the room”
Reviews.Author: wangaijun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. It is not easy to get here from the Fiumicino airport. It is easy to find airport shuttle bus outside the terminals. It costs 8 Euros for single trip and 15 for anytime return. It spent around one hour to Termini (looks like central train station). But you can have a look Roma in bus. From Termini, you can take metro line B to the terminus Rebbibia station. According to the guide in the hotel website, the hotel shuttle bus will take you to hotel in every half hour (15 and 45 in every hours until until 10.45 pm). The pick point is just outside the station (in front of a clothes and shoes stall) But It is not always on time.It would spent around 10 mins to the hotel by the shuttle. It seems to be a safe place to stand outside in night. When I reached the hotel, there were a tourists group waiting for checking in.The hall is full of people. The receptions was busy at answering phone I wait for a while for checking in. The room is as good as other review saying, very clean, big bed, comfortable mattress. But I was stung in the room. Later I found two mosquitos hiding in room. Anyway, do not need worry about the distance to city center. You can take shuttle bus to the Rebbibia station in every 30 hours (it is always on time to leaving the hotel) and then take metro line B to every interesting place in Rome in less than one hour. Rome is not a big city. It is only need one min between each stop in metro line. If no mosquitos, it would be a perfect hotel, especially comparing its price to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel located far from the Rome city center”
Reviews.Author: Peyman1975
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Rome I decided to book this hotel after reading the positive reviews in tripadvisor and also considering the very nice price in comparison with the other hotels in Rome. To reach the central Metro station aka Termini from the Leonardo da Vinci aiport (Fiumicino), one may have three options: Taxis (quite expensive 50 Euros flat-rate), Express train (very slow train which costs 14 Euros/person) and the shuttle bus service (4 Euros/person or 8 Euros when you buy the ticket inside the bus from the driver). From Termini you should walk approx. 10 min. to reach the metro platform Line B proceeding to Rebbibia station. The information in the hotel website mislead us by stating that we should get off at Ponte Mammolo which we did and no shuttle minibus was there to pick us up. It was hard to find out how to reach the hotel and nobody was picking up the phone at the hotel to answer. Somebody there helped us to ride the bus line number 508 (you can also ride the bus line number 451) and get off approx. 500 m. away from the hotel. Finally after 2 hrs. we reached the hotel. Upon checking I found lots of tourists from South East Asia waiting to be checked in. I asked the receptionist why they there was nobody to pick us up and he said that the pick-up plan has changed for some months and it is done from Rebbibia instead of Ponte Mammolo every 30 min. from 8 am until 10.45 pm. The check in was hassle-free and we got the key to the room. The room looks stylish, nice beds, clean bedsheets, very thick curtains, safety deposit box, a fridge and air conditioned. The toilet and the shower is spotless and very clean and it was interesting to find a bidet as well. There is nothing fancy about the room but it's quite small. The breakfast is adequate with lots of choices (especially cakes) and a nice coffee machine. I asked if they have free wi-fi available and the guy at the reception gave me the password to use. The internet speed is acceptable in the morning time but drops dead during night time. There is a branch of Auchan (hypermarket) in front of the hotel which is useful for buying stuff. To sum up, I enjoyed staying in Roma Z3 (Idea Plus) hotel and the only negative point was the distance to the city center which should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubdoc
Reviews.Content: On first impressions, a modern building with open, contemporary feel. The hotel provides complimentary rides to and from the hotel to the nearby metro station. Take a leaflet showing times the driver will pick you up from the metro station Ponte Mammolo. For those who would like some snacks and drinks to have on hand there is a huge Supermarket across the car park (Auchen). The restaurant serves lunch and dinner, I had dinner here and found the food to be delicious - hot and very well presented! The servings are generous. A bar/lounge is open for drinks with complimentary tapas style food. Room service is available during limited hours. The hotel serves a complimentary hot and cold buffet breakfast (Get there early in the morning if the hotel has a lot of tour visitors staying as you'll discover the food will be non-existant! However, the staff do their utmost to refill/stock all food for breakfast). Wireless Internet access (surcharge) is available in public areas. There is a business centre here too. The room is very spacious, modern and has everything you need for a comfortable stay. I would recommend that you stay here as the rooms are reasonably charged and not far from the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, budget choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AussieDave25
Reviews.Content: Many previous reviews spoke highly of this hotel, but complained about the location and the task of getting to the hotel. Found this to be a quite new, high quality hotel with a budget price. Rooms were comfortable with excellent air-con, sky TV, decent size room refrigerator, comfy bedding and well stocked breakfast (included). The hotel offers a shuttle bus service every 15 minutes from "Rebibia" metro station in the morning and the afternoon/ evening - we used this every day with no problems. There is a large "Auchan" supermarket opposite the hotel which was ideal for stocking up on picnic supplies, drinks etc. Had dinner one night in the hotel restaurant using the set menu and this was an excellent meal with lots of flavour and big portion servings. When I next visit Rome I would definitely stay again at this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: DesislavaStr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice in the part of accomodation- nice, clean and well-furnished rooms, very spacious also.Service is a bit chaotic- ladies on reception pretty slow and not quite helpful, shuttle service definitely needs improvement on working hours, and could provide bigger vehicles (one of the days during our 4-days there the only shuttle was with 8 seats!!!!!). Warning- the morning of our check-out they asked us to pay a city tax for our 9-year son, after I talked to them we sorted this out- but still unpleasant experience. Breakfast- pretty abundant, nice coffee machine and great bakery, but not with lots of choice. The transport connections to the centre- very quick by metro but be aware that Rebibbia station is in relatively poor living district, and looks very miserable. If you want to save some money on hotel this is definitely where I suggest you to stay but for pedestrian walks I would suggest you to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Reensx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotelsclick.it who give you 10% off code if you joined their Facebook group, overall worked out about £55 per night. And be aware Rome has a Tourist tax so it's €3 pppn which you pay at the end of your stay. We took a bus from Ciampino to termini which cost €1.20 each and then you have to pay extra per large item of luggage when you get on the bus. Or you can take an express bus which costs €4 each. Getting to the hotel, there are 2 main ways to get to the hotel from termini, you can either get the metro to Ponte Mammolo and then get the bus 451 or 508 and then walk through the path of the field (takes about 5 minutes) and takes you towards the back of the hotel. Alternatively you can take the metro to Rebibbia and then just outside the station (same place it drops off) the shuttle bus runs from there every 30 minutes from 8.15 in the morning to 11.15pm. We used the shuttle just as much as the bus if not more and it was never full, sometimes we were able to get the last seats so its more about your timing than anything. It can take 30 minutes to an hour depending on how things time out. If you're there for a week I'd suggest buying the 7 day travel tickets which cost €16 and work on all the trams, busses, metro & suburban rail in Rome. Check in was easy, hotel itself is very clean and has nice decor around the reception areas and in the rooms. I felt they didn't really tell you the little bits of info you may need to know (breakfast times, shuttle service etc) but that's being really picky. They first said we had to pay for the internet but because we pointed out it said it was free on all booking sites they gave us a code that would last for the holiday and worked fine, it's not fast but it works (about 60kb max dl). The room was very nice, big comfy bed, bigger than a kingsize and not 2 single beds pushed together like you would find a lot in other hotels over europe. Room has a flatscreen tv, small fridge, safe, hair dryer. Bathroom's don't have baths, only showers so if that's an issue its not for you, for us it was great! Rooms are cleaned daily & breakfast was very nice. Did feel like some days it was better than others but again, being really picky. Didn't eat dinner in the hotel but they looked quite busy each night and the prices are reasonable. Bar does a happy hour with lots of nice snacks complimentary. There is a huge supermarket (Auchan) literally 30 seconds away which is very handy for snacks/drinks etc (or buying wine by the gallon). We found a nice restaurant that does chinese and italian food not far from the hotel, if you come out the hotel and walk right up to the main road, it's called Hong Kong, we were utterly stuffed for €20 for the both of us. Got to say a thank you to Paolo (and most male staff on reception) for being so helpful and generally pleasant to speak to. Found the female staff quite cold at times, uninterested. Would definitely return if visiting Rome again :)

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, this is where to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ingjuanito1
Reviews.Content: New, modern, clean and reasonably priced. A very new hotel, somewhat outside the bustle of Roma, but therefore nice and quiet. Very good, free shuttle service to nearest Metro staion which puts Rome within easy reach. The hotel staff are friendly and very helpfull. The rooms are not big, but very wel maintained with all facilities (safe, bar), good beds. Very well stocked breakfast buffet is included in the roomprice, and the same goes for parking. The hotel is very clean and well kept. For Rome, the prices are very reasonable. For those who like that, a major supermarket is just outsied the entrance. Hotel is highly reommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: zotta_zotta
Reviews.Content: We staid for 4 nights during Eastern. After small problems with the orientation we reach the hotel. Auchan supermarket across the street was very helpful. Rooms are spacious, nice and clean. Service was excellent, we went quite late to breakfast and seemed a little poor. Excellent pastry. The hotel is not really close to the city center but the price/value ratio is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Services compared to other Italy's 4* Hotels”
Reviews.Author: cbpapi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is quite new. I really liked the clean and modern bathroom as well as the decoration of the room (vivid colors and hidden lighting). The only things that "bothered" me were the many black stains on one of the walls caused probably by the luggage of previous people who stayed in our room and the slow internet speed that we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Robert30
Reviews.Content: This review will cover the Idea Plus Z3 & its sister hotel closer to the airport. As you read, you will understand. I secured two rooms through an opaque booking site in July 2010 and received the Hotel Pisana Palace (Idea Hotel Roma San Pietro) for me, my wife,and 2 travelling companions for the night of October 19, 2010. This was the last night of our 2 week vacation in Tuscany and the Pisana Palace was only about 30 minutes away from Fiumicino for our early morning departure back to the US. We travel with only a cell phone for emergencies and no computer. This was a vacation, not a "must stay in touch with the world event. Weh we arrived at the Pisana Palace, we were told that they had suffered severe power failures due to equipment difficulties and that our rooms were no longer available. That is understandable, so what is plan B? The young man at the reception desk was very positive and said we would be transferred via their shuttle to a sister facility, Idea Hotel Roma Z3, at no additional expense. We were allowed to store our large luggage and leave the rental vehicle in the underground parking garage at no expense. The hotel could easily have told us, "tough, find another room elsewhere", but they did not. This is what I call a most professional resolution. So, after stowing all the luggage and the car, off we go in the hotel shyttle to the sister property (Z3) on the northeast part of Rome. Took about 45 minutes. When we arrived at the Z3, all arrangements had been made, and we were assigned two "Executive Rooms" on the 7th floor. This was a most generous gesture by the hotel and greatly appreciated. The rooms were spotless, bright, very modern, the bathrooms sparking, and that great full-size shower. Plenty of clean, white towels, hair dryer, heated towel rack, and suffficient accessories. Also included was a large wide-screen TV, mini-referigator, a huge closet, and the beds were very comfortable. This hotel and its sister property are considered 4-star and I agree. The lobby of both properties were large, well-lit, and very clean. Some previous posters complained about the distance from the city center. Rome is a large historical city and unlike the US, old buildings will not be torn down to make room for a hotel. The #14 trolly (tram) Valente Stop is a mere 1 kilometer away, costs 1 Euro each way and delivers you to the main terminal (Termini) in usually about 30 minutes. The tram runs about 5 minutes. This is as easy as it gets to be in the city center in minutes. The dining room was large and can feed tour groups and others wil ease. Remember, this is Europe and if you are intimidated by crowds and jousting for position, stay home. We encoutered a large tour and waited abour 1-2 minutes to get a plate and food from the buffet. The hotel provided this for free and it was a great European breakfast with plenty of hot food. Absolutely no complaints from me or my wife. The next morning, the shuttle from the original property picked us up at 7:45 as scheduled and were transported back to the Pisana Palace, retrieved our bags, the car, and were off to catch our flight back to the US. Folks, this could easily have been a difficult last night in Italy; however, because of the very professional way in which were treated, transferred, and allowed to sleep in the Executive Floor, it worked out perfectly . The hotel and its staff went over and above what they were required to do for us and for that, my wife and I are very appreciative and thank the management and staff of both hotels for being so gracious. Hotel Pisana Palace and Hotel Rome Z3, thank you very much for helping us and I hope that we will be able to stay at your hotel when we return to Rome again. Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Too Far From City Center”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Idea is a new hotel but is not practical for the person who wants to see Rome's attractions. The hotel is located about 10 km from the city center and one wastes valuable time getting to the city center. The hotel seems to be a favorite of tour groups. To get to the city center, one needs to walk about 1 km to the main road, where one can take the tram to the city center, which takes about 40 minutes. Beforehand one has to buy a ticket costing 1 euro at a tobacco shop. All the walking to take the tram may not be practical for people who are not physically fit, and the sidewalk is not level and is quite difficult. The hotel has a small express bus (sits only 16) that takes people to the metro station between 8 am and 10:30 am. Then it restarts at 6:45 pm and ends at 9:15 pm. However since the small bus can fit only 16 people, you may have to line up for the bus very early, because first come first served. The rooms are quite small and it is difficult to open two suitcases on the floor because of lack of space. The dining room is used for the breakfast buffet, but seems to be too small when the large tour groups have breakfast. Many times one has to wait for the waiters to bring more food because the food has been taken by the large tour groups. Also try the modern chairs at the hotel lobby. They are so uncomfortable that your back will ache! My advice to individual travelers is to find a hotel closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel, in terms of location - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Marlena84
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, rooms are very modern and clean. Breakfast was very good. The hotel is about 40 mins away from the city centre, but let's be honet: you won't find a hotel of this standard in the centre of Rome for this price. We didn't mind using public transport (we got a 3 day ticket for public transport for 11 euros). Every day we left the hotel at 10am and came back at 11pm, but we didn't go to Rome to stay in a hotel. Shuttle bus was always full so we never used it, but a local bus number 451 (and there is another one, but I forgot the bus number) was very good, although I would not like to walk from the bus stop in the evening on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Aobisi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night and the next morning is to travel to Tuscany. The location of this hotel is not good as it is not near any place of interests. Auchan is across the road if you need anything. The hotel itself is very modern and trendy as well as the room. The lighting in the room is not very bright. Possibly to add the romantic touch to the night. The room size is cosy for couple. It is new and clean and we enjoy our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Mambo05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and honestly have no complaints. The hotel looks reasonably new, modern with nice seating areas. The only down fall is the hotel has NO SIGN on it so if you go there make sure you know what the building looks like or you wont realise it the hotel. The rooms are big for european rooms, clean and tidy, modern looking, have all the comforts you need (except tea & coffee in the rooms)! Bathrooms are lush, shower is big enough for 2 ;o)!! Rooms were cleaned every day - new bed sheets and towels! There is a safe in the room and a mini bar which was re-stock ever time we used it! Sky TV with lots of free channels. Proper double beds not 2 singles pushed together and amazing curtains that block out all trace of the morning sunshine which was a real bonus cos its get very bright very early! Breakfast is good, lots to choose from and was alway replenished. We didnt eat there in the evening but we did have drinks in the hotel bar, bar man was friendly, polite and spoke decent english. We felt very welcome. Reception gave us maps checking in/out was very easy. Gentleman on reception was exceptionally helpful and spoke very good english. Shuttle bus every morning and evening was brilliant, altho get there early as it fills up quickly!! - note to management we noticed a lot of guests from the near by Holiday Inn coming over to use the service which ment there was no spaces for people actually staying at the Z3! The hotel is a little bit of out the centre but only took 15 mins tops to get to Termini and we didnt find the location a set back at all. It isnt the easiest to find for the first time so..... If you are travelling by public transport. Take the B metro to Ponte Mammolo, as soon as you exit there is a bus station, Take the number 451 bus, get off at the 4th stop (looks like the middle of nowhere on a main road), get off bus and walk right about 200 yards and you should see the hotel, turn left and you are there!! or if you wait at the bus station you will see the shuttle bus with the hotel name on the side (this only runs 7.30-10.30am and 6-9.30pm)

Reviews.Title: “NEXT TO A SAMS CLUB”
Reviews.Author: dianegggg
Reviews.Content: this hotel is new - however it is located 30 euro outside of Rome. It is not recommended for anyone who wants to stay in Rome proper. I felt very mislead. the hotel staff gave me a map of Rome, and when I asked where we were on the map, they indicated we weren't! the hotel is so new there is no name on the hotel so our can driver had a heck of a time finding it from the Train station, and the rooms are the equilavent of your college dorm room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: Ravelijn40
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for recreation and travelled by car. The hotel is very new and the people were very helpful. Although we had our own transportation we did only use public transport. Therefore we toke the tram and metro (10 minutes walk and 25 minutes transport) and you can be everywhere in the city. We did not know about the shuttle, so did not use it. At the other side of the street there is a big Auchan hypermarket and it is opened all day’s from 9 to 21. (except 3 Sunday’s in august). There was not yet wifi in our room, however on the ground floor we could use wifi for free. The breakfast was ok, however the coffee was poor (for a Dutchman). We enjoyed our stay very good. Hans en Joke van den Ham, Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: mee65delhi
Reviews.Content: With some apprehension[after reading reviews] we reached the hotel. We had airport transfer so locating the place was thankfully not a problem. It is a new clean property, and rooms very decently sized. The front desk staff is extremely courteous, patient and helpful. There is a free shuttle every 15 min or so ,connecting to train station so its very convinient. the staff even helped us with maps. what to see and how to reach there!The buffet breakfast is wholesome and sumptuous.ALL IN ALL, I think it is a very good value for its price. well connected and pleasure to stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Idea Hotel Roma Z3
HotelInfo.Address: Via Amos Zanibelli, 00155 Rome, Italy
